content: The Bench, however, said that keeping in mind the monsoon and consequential difficulties usually being faced by the hill State, the poll process must be concluded before May 31

content: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey has demanded that the ‚ÄúLok Sabha membership of Mr. Gandhi be cancelled and he be debarred from contesting elections for life‚Äù

title: With 33 donors, January 2026 sets a record in deceased organ donations in Tamil Nadu
content: Significantly, the maximum contributor was a peripheral medical college hospital ‚Äì Government Dharmapuri Medical College Hospital ‚Äì which functions as a Non-Transplant Organ Retrieval Centre (NTORC)

title: India's Hasina dilemma: Resurgent BNP seeks extradition - what are New Delhi's options?
content: As Bangladesh's new government, led by the BNP, takes charge of country's affair, it has called on India for the extradition of ousted former prime minister Sheikh Hasina, who is in New Delhi. This demand presents a significant diplomatic challenge for India. Dhaka says, it seeks a relationship based on equality and mutual respect, with border security and water sharing also key issues.

title: Beaten by Zimbabwe, Sri Lanka test next: How can Australia reach the Super 8s?
content: Zimbabwe stunned former champions Australia by 23 runs in a major T20 World Cup upset. Batting first, Zimbabwe posted 169/2, with Brian Bennett scoring an unbeaten 64. Australia was bowled out for 146, with Blessing Muzarabani taking four wickets. This victory marks Zimbabwe's second-ever T20 win against Australia.

title: 'When India re-wrote its fate': PM Modi on Seva Teerth, Kartavya Bhawans
content: ‚ÄãThe Prime Minister said the newly inaugurated buildings reflect India‚Äôs commitment to citizen-centric governance and national progress. "Today we all are witnessing a new history being made... This day of 13th February is witnessing a new beginning in India's development journey... Today, we are all entering Seva Teerth and Kartavya Bhavan with the resolve to achieve 'Viksit Bharat'. We have the divine blessings of achieving our goals," he said.

title: Tech layoffs: Amazon, Salesforce & others cut nearly 30,000 jobs in first 40 days of 2026
content: The global tech industry is experiencing significant job losses.  In the first 40 days of 2026, nearly 30,000 roles have been eliminated.  Online giant Amazon announced the largest single layoff, cutting 16,000 jobs.  Other major companies like Salesforce, Meta, and Expedia have also reduced their workforces.  These cuts span various sectors and company sizes.

title: T20 World Cup: Five-star Junaid Siddique, Aryansh Sharma fire UAE to first win
content: UAE secured their first T20 World Cup win, defeating Canada by six wickets. Junaid Siddique's five-wicket haul restricted Canada to a modest total, while Aryansh Sharma and Sohaib Khan's crucial partnership guided UAE to a successful chase. The duo's aggressive batting in the death overs sealed the victory.

title: After CEO asked employees to stop coding, Nvidia engineers get access to OpenAI's Codex
content: Nvidia has deployed OpenAI's Codex AI coding tool to all 30,000 engineers, marking a significant enterprise rollout. CEO Jensen Huang's mandate to automate tasks with AI is driving this adoption, with engineers praising the tool's ability to handle complex workflows and maintain context.

title: Aus down, but not out? Travis Head points to 2023 ODI WC comeback blueprint
content: Zimbabwe secured a significant victory over Australia in the T20 World Cup. They posted 169 runs and successfully defended the total. Australia's captain Travis Head remained optimistic, referencing their 2023 ODI World Cup comeback. Injuries have also affected Australia's squad. This marks a rare World Cup absence of key pacers Cummins, Hazlewood, and Starc together.

title: Rohit Shetty makes first public appearance with son amid heavy security at Mumbai airport
content: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty made his first public appearance at Mumbai airport following a firing incident outside his residence. Accompanied by heavy security, he was seen bidding an emotional farewell to his son. The sighting comes after reports of gunshots near his home, leading to an ongoing investigation and increased security measures in the area.

title: Cisco president Jeetu Patel says company will never hire these developers
content: Cisco's president Jeetu Patel mandates AI for all developers, aiming for half a dozen AI-coded products by 2026. This shift to spec-driven development sees human teams shrink, with AI agents tripling output. While embracing AI's potential, Cisco is investing heavily in security to prevent rogue agents, urging developers to master AI to stay relevant.

title: 2,842 Gazans vaporised by thermobaric bombs? All about shocking weapon 'used' by Israel
content: Thousands of Palestinians have reportedly gone missing in Gaza since October 2023, with Civil Defense teams documenting at least 2,842 disappearances. Military experts suggest the use of high-temperature weapons, like thermobaric munitions, may be responsible for the extreme incineration of human tissue, leaving only biological traces.

title: Lauren Kyle turns heads in Milan as Connor McDavid eyes opener
content: Connor McDavid and Team Canada have arrived in Milan for the 2026 Winter Olympics, beginning preparations for their opener against Czechia. McDavid skated on the top line in practice and shared candid remarks about the Olympic Village and adjusting to jet lag. Off the ice, Lauren Kyle‚Äôs Instagram posts offered fans a personal look at life in Milan, highlighting family support and national pride. Canada, led by captain Sidney Crosby, aims to build on last year‚Äôs international success as Olympic competition begins.

title: Bad Bunny, Kendall Jenner spark buzz after Super Bowl LX show
content: Supermodel and Bad Bunny's ex girlfriend, Kendall Jenner, was spotted at Super Bowl LX as the popular Grammy winner took the stage for his controversial record breaking performance at the halftime show. Soon after the show, rumors of the two rekindling their romance have sparked chaos. Amid this, a clip of two leaving in his luxurious car has sparked panic as many believe the two have got back together.

title: Mavericks vs Lakers injury report: Who‚Äôs playing, out and questionable
content: The Dallas Mavericks and Los Angeles Lakers face off with significant injury concerns impacting both teams. Key players like Cooper Flagg for Dallas and Luka Donƒçiƒá and Deandre Ayton for the Lakers are sidelined. Despite absences, the Lakers, led by LeBron James, are favored at home, while Dallas aims to stay in the playoff hunt.

title: Josh Morrissey doubtful for Switzerland as injury update remains unclear
content: Team Canada is in limbo following the team's defenseman, Josh Morrissey, who left the Olympic match against Team Czechia with an unexplained injury. There was no obvious update given by head coach Jon Cooper, and the question arises concerning the availability of Morrissey in the next game against Team Switzerland. The state of affairs can also affect the defensive pairings when Canada is gearing towards its next vital Olympic competition.

title: B'desh polls: PM Modi dials BNP's Tarique Rahman, hails 'remarkable victory'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated Tarique Rahman on the Bangladesh Nationalist Party's decisive election victory, reaffirming India's commitment to close bilateral ties. Rahman, son of BNP founder Ziaur Rahman, is expected to become prime minister following the party's significant win, ushering in potential political stability.

title: Draft I-T rules 2026 explained: How you can save Rs 1.41 lakh tax outgo
content: What do the draft income tax rules mean for the common man? How does the calculation math for the old vs new income tax regime change? How much more tax can you now save under the old regime with revised exemption and deduction limits? Here are the top changes taxpayers should know:

title: Lakhpati Didis, farmers & start-ups: Details of first files signed by PM Modi at new office
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi signed a series of files from his new office complex, Seva Teerth. He approved a series of decisions focusing on women, youth, farmers and vulnerable citizens. According to the government, the first decisions from Seva Teerth reflect a spirit of ‚ÄúSeva‚Äù and aim to touch every section of society.

title: China sees red as CIA releases video appealing to potential PLA spies
content: The CIA's new Chinese-language recruitment video, targeting China's military, has sparked outrage in Beijing. The clip depicts a PLA officer disillusioned by corruption, a theme echoed by recent purges of top generals. China vows "all necessary measures" against foreign espionage, escalating intelligence rivalry amid US efforts to rebuild its China network.

title: BNP sweeps Bangladesh election: What's next for Muhammad Yunus?
content: Bangladesh's Nationalist Party has secured a decisive victory, paving the way for Tarique Rahman as prime minister. Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus, who led the interim government after a 2024 uprising, is expected to step down. His tenure focused on restoring order and implementing reforms, but the incoming government will face challenges of political polarization and foreign policy recalibration.

title: Hit, treat, repeat: Thailand cricketer bleeds to perfect idol SKY's 'Supla' shot
content: Thailand cricketer Natthakan Chantham is diligently practicing Suryakumar Yadav's signature 'Supla shot', enduring numerous hits in her pursuit of mastering the stroke.  She aims to showcase this fearless batting style, inspired by Yadav, at the upcoming ACC Women‚Äôs Asia Cup Rising Stars 2026 in Bangkok.

title: Palash Muchhal gets relief from Bombay HC in defamation case against Vidnyan Mane
content: Singer Palash Muchhal received interim relief from the Bombay High Court against Vidnyan Mane, who made explosive allegations about Muchhal's cancelled wedding to Smriti Mandhana. The court restrained Mane from publishing further statements, citing potential reputational damage. Mane had accused Muchhal of infidelity and financial fraud, claims Muchhal has vehemently denied.

title: Sensex down over 1,000 points - top 5 reasons for fall
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the equity benchmarks, crashed in trade on Friday amid weak global cues and the continued IT stocks selloff. While Nifty50 went below 25,600, BSE Sensex was down over 700 points.

title: Marvel Rivals Season 6.5 release timings for all regions
content: Marvel Rivals gears up for its major mid-season update, Season 6.5, launching February 13, 2026. The highly anticipated addition is Elsa Bloodstone, the 47th playable hero and a new Duelist. This update also promises significant meta-shifting balance changes and a Valentine's Day celebration, enhancing the hero shooter experience for players worldwide.

title: Man collapses, dies at TVK chief Vijay's rally in Tamil Nadu's Salem
content: A 37-year-old guest worker from Maharashtra, Siraj, tragically passed away during a political meeting in Salem. He had been living in the city for two decades with his family and was known for making silver rings and working in construction.

title: Why Nehru recognised Tibet as a part of China ‚Äî CDS Anil Chauhan explains
content: Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan stated that Jawaharlal Nehru recognized Tibet as part of China to foster a strong relationship, recalling the Panchsheel agreement. He emphasized that India must reconsider its perspective on Himalayan boundaries, particularly in Uttarakhand's middle sector, where the Himalayas have historically served as interaction zones.

title: ‚ÄòIf he pauses...‚Äô: Ashwin‚Äôs fascinating advice to India before Usman Tariq test
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has devised a clever strategy for India's batters facing Pakistan's mystery spinner Usman Tariq. Ashwin suggests batters can leverage the rules by stepping away if Tariq pauses during his run-up, potentially unsettling the bowler and shifting pressure. He also highlighted the difficulty umpires face in judging Tariq's action in real-time, advocating for better technology.

title: Ankur Warikoo shares 5 green flags and 3 red flags of a toxic workplace
content: Entrepreneur Ankur Warikoo identified five green flags for healthy workplaces, including respect, acknowledgement, fair rewards, growth, and mentorship. He also warned of three red flags: dreading work, enduring long hours for minimal pay, and a dismissive "be grateful" attitude. Warikoo emphasizes that a good job challenges without breaking you, urging readers to seek environments that uplift.

title: Mafia don Mukhtar Ansari‚Äôs shooter Shoaib Kidwai shot dead in UP's Barabanki
content: A close associate of slain mafia don Mukhtar Ansari, Shoaib Kidwai alias Bobby, was shot dead in broad daylight in Barabanki. Motorcycle-borne assailants intercepted his car and fired over ten rounds. Police are scanning CCTV footage and have launched combing operations, suspecting gang rivalry as the motive.

title: PMO has a new address: PM Modi unveils ‚ÄòSeva Teerth‚Äô ‚Äî what are the key changes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has inaugurated 'Seva Teerth', a new building complex housing the PMO, National Security Council Secretariat, and Cabinet Secretariat, alongside Kartavya Bhavan 1 and 2. This significant administrative overhaul consolidates key government functions into modern, efficient, and citizen-centric facilities, replacing colonial-era nomenclature with names reflecting public service and duty.

title: Reliance bags US licence to buy Venezuela oil; may help replace Russian crude: Report
content: This general licence permits the acquisition, export, and sale of oil sourced from Venezuela that has already been produced, as well as its refining. Reliance had submitted its licence application in early January.

title: Pirated DVDs of Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' being sold at a shocking price in Pakistan
content: Despite being banned in Pakistan and some Gulf nations, Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' has found an audience through streaming and pirated DVDs in Pakistan. A YouTuber documented the film being openly sold for a mere PKR 50 in Karachi's grey markets, highlighting the demand for Indian cinema.

title: Bike first, crowd next: Speeding car leaves trail of destruction in Lucknow‚Äî CCTV shows horror
content: A speeding car driven by a 21-year-old student ran over six pedestrians near Hanuman Temple in Lucknow's Banthra area, killing a six-year-old boy. The accused, Gaurav Singh, was arrested within hours based on CCTV footage after he attempted to flee the scene. The vehicle, registered in Kanpur, has been seized.

title: Shock in Colombo! Zimbabwe stun Aussies as Muzarabani, Bennett script T20 WC classic
content: Zimbabwe secured a significant upset in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026, defeating Australia by 23 runs. A composed batting effort led by Brian Bennett's unbeaten 64, followed by a dominant bowling display spearheaded by Blessing Muzarabani's 4/17, proved decisive. This victory, their second against Australia in the format, has dramatically opened up Group B.

title: Bowling shake-up vs Pak? Gavaskar hints at big India change for T20 WC showdown
content: Former captain Sunil Gavaskar suggests a tactical shift for India's T20 World Cup clash against Pakistan, hinting at Kuldeep Yadav replacing Arshdeep Singh. Gavaskar noted Arshdeep's incomplete overs and Sri Lankan pitches favoring spinners as reasons for this potential change. He also commented on Sanju Samson's batting, identifying a technical flaw.

title: Gold price today: How much 18K, 22K and 24K gold costs in your city? Check rates
content: Gold futures surged by Rs 1,044 to Rs 1,53,880 per 10 grams on Friday. This rise was fueled by traders establishing fresh positions in response to strong spot market demand. International gold futures also saw an increase, trading at USD 4,962 per ounce.

title: Chloe Kim falls short of snowboarding history and more
content: American snowboarder Chloe Kim fell just short of history at the Winter Olympics on Thursday. Kim, who was trying to become the first snowboarder to win three straight Olympic gold medals with a victory in the women's halfpipe final, looked to be well on track after an 88.00 in her first run. A fall in her second run left her vulnerable, however, and 17-year-old South Korean Choi Ga-on took advantage, scoring a 90.25 in her third run. Kim was unable to overcome that deficit, falling in her third run. The preliminary round for men's ice hockey began with the U.S. and Canada among countries in action. The U.S. team hasn't won gold in men's Olympic hockey since 1980, but this year it's gold medal or bust. "That's the expectation," captain Auston Matthews  said . Both the U.S. and Canada got started on the right foot in their openers, winning 5-1 and 5-0, respectively. MORE:   Medal tracker  |  Full schedule of events  |  Olympics 101 Below are the top moments from Thursday's events.

title: Men's Bubble Watch: Virginia Tech gets biggest victory yet with Clemson upset

title: Opening-game onslaught: Grades, top players, key questions from Team USA's win over Latvia
content: team USA has won its opening game in the 2026 men's ice hockey tournament . it upended Latvia by a final score of 5-1 . the first period included two successful coach's challenges from Latvia . there are certain players every team must rely on if it's going to win .
